channel.title: Registered port
channel.description:
on my router in remote management control would i edit registered ports there? zyxkel eq-660r.
ive editted my ports to 43594 start no. to end no. thats all done dont even talk about that.
but in remote management control the ports on it are.
server type telnet ftp https http
secured client ip:
access status:telnet-lan only port:23 0.0.0.0 access status:ftp-lan only port:21 0.0.0.0 access status:https-all port:443 0.0.0.0 access status:http-all port:80 0.0.0.0
do i change anything here? cause when i try to post the server on moparscape server stat. it says server must be online and someone said if i have a registered port thats my problem. so what changes do i make.?

item.title: Registered port
item.dc:creator: @abcNoob abcNoob
item.description:
@abcNoob wrote:

On another topic

Basically, you have to port forward the port on your internal IP, not your localhost.

A detailed explanation was given already, now shut up!

Read full topic

item.title: Registered port
item.dc:creator: @abcNoob abcNoob
item.description:
@abcNoob wrote:

You should port map and forward it to your computer.

Don’t listen to the noobs that say that it welcomes hackers. Only forward port 43594, not any other port.

Also, you need the ‘REAL’ IP of your computer, not 0.0.0.0. Because 0.0.0.0 says access yourself, or self access.

If you still don’t understand, here is what I mean:

On my computer, my Local IP address is 10.0.1.3 (example IP address, to prevent HACKERS). So I forward it to 10.0.1.3.
0.0.0.0 is the same as localhost, or 127.0.0.1, which causes the computer to
start a connection with itself.
So you need to find the IP of your computer. Get up the No-IP DUC. Change a setting to: Local IP From this Computer. Then save changes
It should show you your computer’s IP, forward it to that IP. Now change the setting back to the way it was before and then save changes.

I hope this helps.

–Magma is correct, Remote Management has nothing to do with Port Forwarding…

Read full topic
